meanings.definition: A circular building with a conical or vaulted roof, typically a tomb or temple.
meanings.sent1: The ancient tholos stood proudly in the center of the village.
meanings.sent2: Visitors marveled at the intricate design of the tholos in the archaeological site.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous children played hide-and-seek around the tholos, pretending it was a magical castle.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a tholos of memories, each one carefully stored and preserved.
meanings.sent5: The tholos loomed in the distance, a symbol of ancient craftsmanship and reverence.

meanings.definition: A dome-shaped structure, especially in ancient Greek architecture.
meanings.sent1: The tholos on top of the building added a touch of elegance to the design.
meanings.sent2: The ruins of the tholos hinted at the grandeur of the civilization that once thrived there.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons found a cozy spot to nest under the tholos, enjoying the shade it provided.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed under the tholos, filling the space with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The tholos gleamed in the sunlight, a beacon of history and artistry.
